Articles.Content:
I posted this the other day before I had attached any of the modular fuel tanks. Now here it is! In it's full 376 Ton Glory!

The logistics required for getting this thing fully equipped were a nightmare. Each tank took about 25 to 45 minutes to dock. Here's one of the Beta tanks (The ones with Large RCS tanks) coming in for a rendezvous.

And again, if anyone is interested, here are the links to craft files:

Sorenti-Class Heavy Tanker - http://www./download/qlyykkwkqckl1gm/Sorenti_Heavy_Tanker.craft

Dropper Tank Alpha - http://www./download/7b4tem01zwz990k/Dropper_Tank_Alpha.craft

Dropper Tank Beta - http://www./download/152sccv6jbez1j1/Dropper_Tank_Beta.craft

The Tanker has Four power settings for the engines: 1 toggles the Skipper engine, 2 Toggles all six nuclear engines, 3 toggles all seven engines, 4 toggles the outter two Nuclear engines.

(For those who try it out, let me know what you think! I'm open to suggestions and critisism.)

Whelp, that's it for now. I'm off to explore the solar system!
I love putting ships together on orbit, and lengthy docking operations. Good job!

I love putting ships together on orbit, and lengthy docking operations. Good job!

Haha! Thanks. This things first stop is Duna to refuel a frigate that can't quite make it back home
But if youre gonna explore, shouldnt you take some probes with you? or at least a lander or rover?

But if youre gonna explore, shouldnt you take some probes with you? or at least a lander or rover?

...Just a minor oversight...
